description: Creates a template in the Cases domain. This template is used to define the case object model (that is, to define what data can be captured on cases) in a Cases domain. A template must have a unique name within a domain, and it must reference existing field IDs and layout IDs. Additionally, multiple fields with same IDs are not allowed within the same Template. A template can be either Active or Inactive, as indicated by its status. Inactive templates cannot be used to create cases. Other template APIs are:

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

parameters.name: layoutConfiguration
parameters.description: Configuration of layouts associated to the template. defaultLayout (string) --- Unique identifier of a layout.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A name for the template. It must be unique per domain.

parameters.name: requiredFields
parameters.description: A list of fields that must contain a value for a case to be successfully created with this template. (dict) --- List of fields that must have a value provided to create a case. Unique identifier of a field.

parameters.name: rules
parameters.description: A list of case rules (also known as case field conditions) on a template. (dict) --- An association representing a case rule acting upon a field. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template. Unique identifier of a case rule. Unique identifier of a field.

nested_params.name: caseRuleId
nested_params.description: Unique identifier of a case rule.

nested_items.name: templateArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the newly created template.

nested_items.name: templateId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier of a template.
